body.p: An entity enters into a contract with a customer and promises to grant a franchise licence that provides the customer with the right to use the entity’s trade name and sell the entity’s products for 10 years. In addition to the licence, the entity also promises to provide the equipment necessary to operate a franchise store. In exchange for granting the licence, the entity receives a sales-based royalty of five per cent of the customer’s monthly sales. The fixed consideration for the equipment is CU150,000 payable when the equipment is delivered.
